channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flooding issue, 21st October
item.description:
Road always floods - appears to be a spring or water mains leak. At side of road heading southbound towards Bishops Cleeve
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Half of a bed base, 21st October
item.description:
Unfortunately this is the 3rd dumped item that I have reported in the last month, someone is obviously having a. clear out and dumping their furniture in this area piece by piece corner of Stanwick Drive /Windyridge Road by the wall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Windyridge Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole not properly seated in hole, 21st October
item.description:
Manhole has slipped inwards and is clearly loose. \it has been pulled back a bit since the photo was taken, but will continue to loosed as vehicles drive over it. This could be dangerous for pedestrians, especially children or pets such as cats.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinemount Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped rubbish outside 2 Oldfield Crescent, 21st October
item.description:
Fly tipped rubbish outside 2 Oldfield Crescent. Please could you arrange for this to be cleared? Many thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsley Gardens, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: An 18‚Äù‚Äù (45.7cm x 14‚Äù (35.6cms) pothole in the middle of the road. The deepest point is approx 3‚Äù (7.6cms), 21st October
item.description:
The pothole is right outside my house, No 15 Sandown Road, Bishop's Cleeve. Cars running over it are throwing up stones from it ( some people race up/down this road). When we reverse our car off the driveway we try to avoid it but we‚Äôre not always successful especially when we drive onto our driveway. It is getting bigger and I‚Äôm worried for safety reasons and that stones may be thrown up onto our car, or indeed other people‚Äôs cars. It‚Äôs been there about 6-8 weeks and is progressively getting worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Sandown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is rotting, 21st October
item.description:
On grass outside 21 bishop road. The tree has a large hole that seems to be getting deeper daily. Its looks like its rotting away and the tree is leaning towards a house with where an oap lives. The tree is definitly not healthy as the leaves are all turning brown where the same type of tree behind it is still green. The tree also creaks a lot more now when windy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Bishop Road, Shurdington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All drains blocked and car park flooding as a result, 21st October
item.description:
The drain outside 6 Weir Bridge is blocked. The drain in the car park as you are facing 12 and 12A Manor Gardens, is blocked. The drain in the middle of the car park in between 12 Manor Gardens and 11 Manor Gardens is blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Bridge Close, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep hole coming up the leckhampton Hill, 21st October
item.description:
The hole is on the left hand carriageway heading out of Cheltenham,Deep and narrowly avoided Before you get to the long layby with the viewpoint opposite .NOTED ON THE MAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Ref 6563686., 21st October
item.description:
Reported Oct 7th Now Oct 21st. Previous repair badly breaking down. Hit it at speed yesterday. Now I know it is there I can try to avoid it. No white lines or any warning on this fast road. Please revisit urgently. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester

item.title: Cast iron bollard has been hit/moved/damaged and f/w surface raised - trip hazard minimum but very likely deliberately damaged/removed so vehicles can get around intentional obstruction/restriction (this is not the lockable ones on the island but the permanent ones set i the f/w) - a second bollard on either f/w would remove this possibility in future, please resolve imminently!, 21st October
item.description:

item.description:
